modelIdentification.name: Communications
modelIdentification.releaseRestriction: TBD by US Government (expected to be "Unlimited Release")
modelIdentification.purpose: Patient documents, radio communication, and command control messages
modelIdentification.description: The Communications module will contain models of patient documentation forms, radio communication, and command and control messages. Classes in the Communications module are "Perceived Truth" and are supplied/recorded by the trainee based on observations and treatments of the "Ground Truth" patient in the Patient module.
modelIdentification.useLimitation: The Medical Modeling and Simulation Federation Object Model by Information Visualization and Innovative Research, Inc. is licensed under CC BY-ND 4.0. To view a copy of this license, visit https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nd/4.0/

poc.pocOrg: Information Visualization and Innovative Research Inc.

attribute.name: patientId
attribute.semantics:
patientId uniquely identifies a patient.
Once a Patient object is created, the ID is static and cannot be changed or reused during an execution.

attribute.name: battleRosterNumber
attribute.semantics: Record first letter of patient’s first name, then first letter of patient’s last name, then record the last four numbers of patient’s Social Security number. For example, John Doe 123-12-1234 is Battle Roster # ‘JD1234’.

attribute.name: evacuationLevelRequest
attribute.semantics: Urgent, Priority, Routine level of evac request

attribute.name: lastName
attribute.semantics: Last name of patient

attribute.name: firstName
attribute.semantics: first name of patient

attribute.name: socialSecurityAccountNumber
attribute.semantics: Some 1380 instructions call for full ssan, others last 4. Also, some injured personnel may not have a SSAN.

attribute.name: gender
attribute.semantics: Gender of patient

attribute.name: date
attribute.semantics: Write date of injury in DD-MMM-YY format. For example, “29-JUN-13”.

attribute.name: time
attribute.semantics: Write 24 hour time of injury, and indicate whether local (L) or zulu (Z) time. For example, “1300Z”.

attribute.name: service
attribute.semantics:
String describing the service branch...
Typical entries are USCIV, NON US, USA, USAF, CG, USN, USMC

attribute.name: unit
attribute.semantics: Unit the patient is attached to. Leave blank if unknown or N/A

attribute.name: allergies
attribute.semantics: String containing allergies if known. Multiple allergies should be separated by a comma

attribute.name: mechanismOfInjury
attribute.semantics: Check all mechanisms of injury that apply.

attribute.name: injuryAnnotation
attribute.semantics: Injury section of the DD1380. Consists of four extremity tourniquets and an array of injury/location entries.

attribute.name: signsSymptoms
attribute.semantics: The DD1380 allows four entries for signs and symptoms. These are the "perceived" signs and symptoms as determined and recorded by the medic trainee.

attribute.name: treatmentCirculatoryTourniquet
attribute.semantics:
Mark an “X” for all Circulation hemorrhage control interventions. For tourniquets (TQ), mark category (Extremity, Junctional and/or Truncal) and write name of TQ(s) used.
For dressings, mark category (Hemostatic, Pressure, and/or Other) and write type of dressing(s) used.

attribute.name: treatmentCirculatoryDressing
attribute.semantics: For dressings, mark category (Hemostatic, Pressure, and/or Other) and write type of dressing(s) used.

attribute.name: treatmentAirway
attribute.semantics: Mark an “X” for all Airway interventions (Intact, NPA (nasopharyngeal airway), CRIC (cricothyroidotomy), ET Tube (endotracheal tube), SGA (supraglottic airway) and write type of device(s) used

attribute.name: treatmentBreathing
attribute.semantics: Mark an “X” for all Breathing interventions (O2 (oxygen), Needle-D (needle decompression), Chest-Tube, Chest-Seal) and write type of device(s) used

attribute.name: treatmentFluids
attribute.semantics: Circulation resuscitation interventions. Write name, volume, route, and time of any fluids given.

attribute.name: treatmentBloodProducts
attribute.semantics: Circulation resuscitation interventions. Write name, volume, route, and time of any blood products given.

attribute.name: treatmentMedicationsAnalgesic
attribute.semantics: Medications. Write name, dose, route, and time of any analgesics given.

attribute.name: treatmentMedicationsAntibiotic
attribute.semantics: Medications. Write name, dose, route, and time of any antibiotics given.

attribute.name: treatmentMedicationsOther
attribute.semantics: Medications. Write name, dose, route, and time of any other administered medications.

attribute.name: treatmentOther
attribute.semantics: Mark an “X” for other treatments administered (combat pill pack, eye shield (mark right (R) or left (L)), splint, hypothermia prevention) and type of device(s) used.

attribute.name: treatmentNotes
attribute.semantics: Use this space to record any other pertinent information and/or clarifications.

attribute.name: responder
attribute.semantics: Information about the first responder providing the care

objectClass.name: PatientEvacuationTag
objectClass.semantics:
DD 602
Source: FM 8-10-6 Appendix H Section 3 DD Form 602. Implements NATO STANAG 2132.
The DD Form 602, Patient Evacuation Tag, is a record of the patient's medical treatment. When evacuating a patient aboard during HCAA operations, the DD Form 1380 will suffice as a treatment record if the DD Form 602 is not available.
Placeholder.

objectClass.name: PatientEvacuationManifest
objectClass.semantics:
DD601 Source: FM 8-10-6, Appendix H, Section 2
AF AE system requires a DD 601.
Placeholder.

objectClass.name: InpatientTreatmentRecord
objectClass.semantics:
DA 3647: Inpatient Treatment Record Cover Sheet
Placeholder.

objectClass.name: VitalSignsRecord
objectClass.semantics: SF 511 - Patient Vital Signs Record - Part of permanent patient record. Placeholder.

objectClass.name: DA4700_MedicalRecordSupplemental
objectClass.semantics:
See AR 40-66 regarding use of this form.
Placeholder.
Attribute names are preceded with a "letter_" with the following distinction:
a_ refers to the top section Event through Capability and the bottom Section labeled Patient's Identification
b_ refers to the Circulation - Hemorrhage Control section
c_ refers to the Airway section
d_ refers to the Breathing section
e_ refers to the Annotate Injuries section
f_ refers to the Circulation - Assessment section
g_ refers to the Circulation - Resuscitation section
h_ refers to the Vital Signs section
i_ refers to the Additional Interventions section
j_ refers to the Medications and Fluids section
k_ refers to several sections: Documents Received, Narrative Summary of Care, Enroute Care Provider and Casualty's Protective Equipment
l_ refers to AAR Discussion, Sustains and Improves sections

attribute.name: patientId
attribute.semantics:
patientId associates a particular patient to a particular Communications document.
Once a patient ID is assigned to a document, the ID is static and cannot be changed or reused during an execution.

attribute.name: a_event
attribute.semantics: Event section of the 4700.

attribute.name: a_nineLine
attribute.semantics: 9-line section of the 4700.

attribute.name: a_traumaMistDiagnosis
attribute.semantics: The Trauma Mist Report / Disease Diagnosis section of the 4700.

attribute.name: a_pickupDropoff
attribute.semantics: Pickup and Dropoff sections of the 4700.

attribute.name: a_capability
attribute.semantics: Mark an ‘X’ for each capability present for this patient/mission. If ‘Other’, record the other capability present.

attribute.name: a_patientIdentification
attribute.semantics: Bottom section of all three pages of the 4700.

attribute.name: a_preparedBy
attribute.semantics: Information about the person preparing the DA4700.

attribute.name: b_hemorrhageControl
attribute.semantics: Describe the type of dressing or direct pressure used to control hemorrhage.

attribute.name: b_priorTourniquetAssessTighten
attribute.semantics: document whether prior tourniquets are assessed or tightened.

attribute.name: b_extremityTourniquetsApplied
attribute.semantics: Record tourniquets applied to extremities.

attribute.name: b_junctionalTourniquetApplied
attribute.semantics: Record junctional tourniquet if applied.

attribute.name: b_tourniquetComment
attribute.semantics: Record clarifying notes for tourniquets.

attribute.name: c_airwayTreatmentType
attribute.semantics: Mark an ‘X’ for all types of airway treatment given. Self (none, patient breathes without assistance), NPA (nasopharyngeal airway), OPA (oropharyngeal airway), Cric (cricothyroidotomy), Trach (tracheotomy), ETT (endotracheal tube), SGA (supraglottic airway). Type. Record type of supraglottic airway treatment.

attribute.name: c_airwayTube
attribute.semantics: Size. Record the size of tube. Pos __ @ ___. Record the position (first blank) and select the Gums, Nare, or Teeth (second blank) from the dropdown list.

attribute.name: c_airwayConfirmation
attribute.semantics: Mark an ‘X’ for all methods used to confirm breathing, BS (breath sounds), Vis (visualization/chest rise), ETCO2 (End Tidal CO2 device).

attribute.name: c_airwayO2Source
attribute.semantics: Mark an ‘X’ for all sources used to deliver oxygen, NC (nasal cannula and nasal catheters), NRB (non-rebreather mask), BVM (bag valve mask), Vent (mechanical ventilator). LPM. Record flow of oxygen in liters per minute.

attribute.name: c_airwayIntubated
attribute.semantics: Mark an ‘X’ for Prior to transport (intubation occurred prior to transport); By transport crew (intubation occurred during transport).

attribute.name: c_airwaySuction
attribute.semantics: Mark an ‘X’ for ETT (Endotracheal tube), Yaunker (Oral suction tube).

attribute.name: d_needleDecompression
attribute.semantics: DA4700 allows four records for needle decompression.

attribute.name: d_chestTube
attribute.semantics: Time. Record 24-hour time of chest tube insertion in the same time zone as marked in ‘Time Zone’ above. Mark an ‘X’ for R (right) and/or L (left) chest tube location.

attribute.name: d_chestEqualRiseAndFall
attribute.semantics: Mark a ‘’for Y (yes), N (no) or N/A (not applicable) of equal chest rise and fall.

attribute.name: d_respiratoryEffort
attribute.semantics: Mark an ‘X’ for Unlabored, Labored, Agonal, and Assisted respiratory effort.

attribute.name: d_ventSettings
attribute.semantics: DA4700 allows up to 4 readings. One initial and three changes.

attribute.name: e_annotateInjuries
attribute.semantics: A dynamic length array associating injuries with body locations per the DA4700 Annotate Injuries section.

attribute.name: f_rhythymEctopy
attribute.semantics: Document any cardiac rhythym irregularities.

attribute.name: f_pulse
attribute.semantics: Select A, D, +1, +2, +3 from the dropdown list for RAD, BRAC, CAR, FEM, PED, TEMP.

attribute.name: g_transfusionIndication
attribute.semantics: Mark an ‘X’ to indicate the reason for the transfusion: Amputation, HR (heart rate) > 120, SBP (systolic blood pressure) < 90.

attribute.name: g_bloodIinfusion
attribute.semantics: Record up to two blood infusions.

attribute.name: g_intravenousPeripheral
g_intraosseousType
attribute.semantics: Record the type of Intraosseous line used.

attribute.name: g_intraosseousSite
attribute.semantics: Record the site of the Intraosseous injection.

attribute.name: g_centralLine
attribute.semantics: Identify any IV Central Line and location the insertion is made.

attribute.name: g_arterialLine
attribute.semantics: Arterial Line. Mark an ‘X’ for R (right), L (left) Wrist; R (right), L (left) Groin sites.

attribute.name: h_vitalSigns
attribute.semantics: Patient vital signs may be taken and recorded up to 4 times.

attribute.name: h_eyeAssessment
attribute.semantics: Use PERRLA assessment.

attribute.name: h_fieldUltrasoundResults
attribute.semantics: Record ultrasound results.

attribute.name: h_otherDiagnostics
attribute.semantics: Record any other diagnostic results not otherwise specified.

attribute.name: i_foley
attribute.semantics: Document application of Foley catheter.

attribute.name: i_gastricTube
attribute.semantics: Record oral or nasal gastric tube intervention.

attribute.name: i_eyeProtection
attribute.semantics: Document eye protection application to the injured patient. Not to be confused with Eye Protection in Casualty's Protective Equipment which refers to eye protection worn by the injured patient WHEN THE INJURY WAS INFLICTED.

attribute.name: i_immobilization
attribute.semantics: Document any immobilization devices administered to the patient.

attribute.name: i_warming
attribute.semantics: Document any hypothermia prevention intervention(s). Up to two may be documented.

attribute.name: i_otherInterventions
attribute.semantics: Document other interventions not specified earlier. Up to two other interventions are allowed in the 4700.

attribute.name: j_medicationsAndFluids
attribute.semantics: Array of entries for medications and fluids administered to the patient.

attribute.name: k_documentsReceived
attribute.semantics: Mark an ‘X’ for all documents received with the patient. TCCC (TCCC, DD1380 Tactical Combat Casualty Care Card), Patient Chart, None. If Other documentation was received, record the type, document title and/or description.

attribute.name: k_narrativeSummaryOfCare
attribute.semantics: Record a summary of the care provided for the medical record. Do not include items documented previously. Do not include classified information.

attribute.name: k_enrouteCareProvider
attribute.semantics: Document care providers for enroute care. Note on the electronic form: Signature locks and prevents edits to Provider Name information.

attribute.name: k_casualtyProtectiveEquipment
attribute.semantics: Mark "X" for any protective equipment worn by the patient at the time of injury. Important for after action analysis to determine if injured patient was actually wearing appropriate protective equipment. This does not represent any protective equipment placed on the patient AFTER injury to protect or treat the patient.

attribute.name: l_eventDate
attribute.semantics: Event date that the AAR is discussing.

attribute.name: l_tacticalComplications
attribute.semantics: Mark "X" if the tactical situation complicated patient care. Explain how in the following discussion section.

attribute.name: l_discussion
attribute.semantics: Discussion section.

attribute.name: l_sustains
attribute.semantics: Sustains section.

attribute.name: l_improves
attribute.semantics: Improves section.

objectClass.name: ProlongedFieldCareCard
objectClass.semantics: Prolonged Field Care (PFC) card used to document patient data during prolonged field care. (Version v22 10 June 2019)

attribute.name: patientId
attribute.semantics:
patientId uniquely identifies a patient.
Once a Patient object is created, the ID is static and cannot be changed or reused during an execution.

attribute.name: header
attribute.semantics: Header section of PFC card

attribute.name: sample
attribute.semantics:
igns/symptoms; llergies; edications;

ast Medical History; ast oral intake; vents leading to injury

attribute.name: mistReport
attribute.semantics: MIST report

attribute.name: tourniquet
attribute.semantics: PFC supports recording four tourniquets. Time On and Time Converted are recorded.

attribute.name: tranexamicAcid
attribute.semantics: PFC supports recording two dosings of TXA times.

attribute.name: bloodAnalysis
attribute.semantics: Array of blood analysis tests

attribute.name: notes
attribute.semantics: Notes, telemedicine recommendation /red flags and Standing Orders:

attribute.name: flowsheet
attribute.semantics: 33 element array of flowsheet records for the PFC card

attribute.name: treatmentChecklist
attribute.semantics: Treatment checklist

objectClass.name: Document
objectClass.semantics: Representation of a document in various formats. Stored as a byte array. To write out the file, use "documentName" + extension identified by documentTypeEnum

attribute.name: documentName
attribute.semantics: filename of the document being stored

attribute.name: patientId
attribute.semantics:
patientId uniquely identifies a patient.
Once a Patient object is created, the ID is static and cannot be changed or reused during an execution.

attribute.name: documentType
attribute.semantics: Type of file being represented. Indicates the file extension if the file is to be written out.

attribute.name: documentBody
attribute.semantics: Byte array to store the body of the file.

parameter.name: line1
parameter.semantics: Location at pickup site in grid coordinates

parameter.name: line2
parameter.semantics: Radio Frequency, call sign and suffix

parameter.name: line3
parameter.semantics:
Number of patients by precedence A-URGENT B-URGENT-SURG C-PRIORITY D-ROUTINE E-CONVENIENCE
If 2 or more categories must be reported in the same request, insert the word "BREAK" between each category

parameter.name: line4
parameter.semantics:
Special equipment required
A-NONE B-HOIST C-EXTRACTION EQUIPMENT D-VENTILATOR

parameter.name: line5
parameter.semantics:
Number of patients by type <L>itter/<A>mbulatory
If both types are requested, insert the word "BREAK" between them.

parameter.name: line6
parameter.semantics:
NATO: Security at Pickup Zone (PZ)
US: Wartime: Security at Pickup Zone (PZ) Peacetime: Number and type of wound, injury or illness.

parameter.name: line7
parameter.semantics:
Pickup Zone (PZ) Marking Methods
A-Panels B-Pyro C-Smoke D-None E-Other (explain)

parameter.name: line8
parameter.semantics:
Number of patients by nationality. Number of patients in each category need not be transmitted
US 9 liner -------------------------------- A - US Military B - US Citizen C - Non-US Military D - Non-US Citizen E - Enemy POW
NATO 9 liner -------------------------------- A - Coalition Military B - Civilian with Coalition Forces C - Non-Coalition Security Forces D - Non-Coalition Civilian E - Opposing Forces/PW/Detainee F - Child

parameter.name: line9
parameter.semantics:
US - Wartime: Chem Bio Radiological contamination (include ONLY when applicable) C-Chemical B-Biological R-Radiological N-Nuclear
US - Peacetime: Terrain Description. Terrain features in and around proposed landing site. If possible, describe relationship of site to prominent terrain feature.
NATO: Pickup Zone Terrain/Obstacles

parameter.name: audioStream
parameter.semantics: If a 9 liner message is sent from a pre-recorded or live audio stream, this variable will be used.

interactionClass.name: MISTReport
interactionClass.semantics: MIST: Mechanism of Injury (GSW, RPG, IED, etc.) Injuries sustained (Bilateral leg amputation, penetrating trauma to the face etc.) Give this in PMARCHP order so that nothing is missed Signs & Symptoms (BP, respiratory rate, HR etc.) Treatments rendered (Right arm splinted, TQs applied to both legs etc.)

parameter.name: mechanism
parameter.semantics: Mechanism of injury and at what time if known

parameter.name: signs
parameter.semantics:
Symptoms and vital signs
A - Airway B - Breathing Rate C - Pulse Rate D - Conscious/unconscious E - Other signs/symptoms

parameter.name: treatment
parameter.semantics: Treatment Given (e.g. tourniquet and time applied, medications)

enumeratedData.name: AirwayTubeLocationEnum
enumeratedData.semantics: Gums - Teeth missing, Blast, infant, elderly Nare - nostril. Medic would likely annotate which nostril Teeth - between teeth

enumeratedData.name: CentralLineLocationEnum
enumeratedData.semantics: Fem-R, Right Femoral Vein (groin) Fem L, Left Femoral Vein (groin) IJ-R, Right Internal Jugular Central Venous Line IJ-L, Left Internal Jugular Central Venous Line Subclav-R, Right Subclavian Central Venous Catheter Subclav-L, Left Subclavian Central Venous Catheter

enumeratedData.name: BloodComponentEnum
enumeratedData.semantics: FDP - Fresh Dried Plasma FFP - Fresh Frozen Plasma PRBC - Packed Red Blood Cells.

enumeratedData.name: EnrouteCareProviderCapabilityEnum
enumeratedData.semantics: none [left blank] EMT-B[asic] EMT-I[ntermediate] EMT-P[aramedic] EMT-FPC [Certified Flight Paramedic] RN Registered Nurse, CRNA [certified registered nurse anesthetist (CRNA)] PA [physicians assistant] MD/DO [Medical Doctor (MD) and Doctor of Osteopathy (DO)]

enumeratedData.name: InjuriesTypeEnum
enumeratedData.semantics:
Enumerate the injuries that can be used in the Annotate Injures section of the DA4700
(AMP)utation (C)repitus (D)eformity (DG)Degloving (FX)Fracture (GSW)Gunshot Wound (H)ematoma (LAC)eration (PW)Puncture Wound (PP)Peppering (TBI)Suspect Other (B)urn % TBSA (E)cchymosis (BL)eeding (IMP)Impaled Object (P)ain (SQA)Subcutaneous Air

enumeratedData.name: MedicineRouteEnum
enumeratedData.semantics: [DA4700] Medications and Fluids section Enumeration of the route of medicine administration: IM - Intramuscular IN - Inhalation IO - Intraosseus IV - Intravenous PO - Oral PR - Rectal SL - Sub-lingual SQ - Subcutaneous

enumeratedData.name: MechanismOfInjuryEnum
enumeratedData.semantics: [DA4700] Select the dominant/primary Mechanism of injury from the dropdown list. If more than one Mechanism, specify additional mechanisms in Comments.

enumeratedData.name: InjuryEnum
enumeratedData.semantics: [DA4700] Used in the Trauma MIST Report Section.

enumeratedData.name: DocumentTypeEnum
enumeratedData.semantics: Identify the file type extension for a document being represented

arrayData.name: BreathingNeedleDecompressionArray
arrayData.semantics: [DA4700] Needle Decompression section allows for four entries of Needle Decompression

arrayData.name: BreathingVentSettingsArray
arrayData.semantics: [DA4700] The DA4700 has four entries, Initial and three changes

arrayData.name: SignsSymptomsArray
arrayData.semantics: [DD1380] allows four entries in the form for signs and symptoms.

arrayData.name: TreatmentFluidArray
arrayData.semantics: [DA 1380] allows for two entries for fluids administered.

arrayData.name: TreatmentMedicationsAnalgesicArray
arrayData.semantics: [DD1380] allows for three dosages of analgesics

arrayData.name: TreatmentMedicationsAntibioticsArray
arrayData.semantics: [DD1380] allows for two types of antibiotics to be administered

arrayData.name: treatmentMedicationsOtherArray
arrayData.semantics: [DD1380] allows for two meds (not analgesic or antibiotic) to be administered.

arrayData.name: BloodInfusionArray
arrayData.semantics: [DA4700] allows two blood infusion records

arrayData.name: VitalSignsArray
arrayData.semantics: [DA4700] Records of patient vital signs taken at (up to) 4 different times.

arrayData.name: WarmingArray
arrayData.semantics: [DA4700] Array of hypothermia prevention interventions. Form allows two.

arrayData.name: OtherInterventionsArray
arrayData.semantics: [DA4700] Array of other interventions not otherwise specified. 4700 allows two.

arrayData.name: TourniquetArray
arrayData.semantics: [DD1380] Document up to four extremity tourniquet applied

arrayData.name: EnrouteCareProviderArray
arrayData.semantics: [DA4700] List (up to two) Care Providers who provided assistance in patient care while enroute. NOTE: Signature locks and prevents edits to Provider Name information.

arrayData.name: AnnotateInjuriesArray
arrayData.semantics: [DA4700] A dynamic length array of Injury/InjuryLocation records for the Annotate Injuries section

arrayData.name: MedicationsAndFluidsArray
arrayData.semantics: [DA4700] up to 12 entries for the Medications and Fluids section

arrayData.name: InjuryLocationArray
arrayData.semantics: [DD1380] Array of injury and physical body location associations

arrayData.name: PFC_TourniquetArray
arrayData.semantics: [PFC] PFC record for up to four tourniquets applied and converted

arrayData.name: PFC_FlowsheetArray
arrayData.semantics: [PFC] Array of flowsheet records for the PFC flowsheet array.

arrayData.name: PFC_BloodAnalysisArray
arrayData.semantics: [PFC] Blood Analysis section of the PFC. Allows 6 readings.

arrayData.name: PFC_InjuryTreatmentAnnotationArray
arrayData.semantics: [PFC] Dynamic array of injury location/description/treatment entries

arrayData.name: documentBodyArray
arrayData.semantics: A dynamic length byte array of maximum 250 MB. Byte array is used to store the bytes of the document body.

fixedRecordData.name: CapabilityRecord
fixedRecordData.semantics: [DA4700] Mark an ‘X’ for each capability present for this patient/mission. If ‘Other’, record the other capability present. EMT-I[ntermediate] EMT-P[aramedic] EMT-FPC [Certified Flight Paramedic] RN Registered Nurse, CRNA [certified registered nurse anesthetist (CRNA)] PA [physicians assistant] MD/DO [Medical Doctor (MD) and Doctor of Osteopathy (DO)]

field.name: basicEmergencyMedicalTechnician
field.semantics: false = No true = Yes

field.name: intermediateEmergencyMedicalTechnician
field.semantics: false = No true = Yes

field.name: paramedicEmergencyMedicalTechnician
field.semantics: false = No true = Yes

field.name: certifiedFlightParamedicEmergencyMedicalTechnician
field.semantics: false = No true = Yes

field.name: registeredNurse
field.semantics: false = No true = Yes

field.name: certifiedRegisteredNurseAnesthetist
field.semantics: false = No true = Yes

field.name: physiciansAssistant
field.semantics: false = No true = Yes

field.name: medicalDoctor
field.semantics: false = No true = Yes

field.name: otherCapability
field.semantics: If ‘Other’, record the other capability present.

fixedRecordData.name: HemorrhageControlRecord
fixedRecordData.semantics: [DA4700] Mark an ‘X’ for each type of dressing used to control bleeding. If ‘Other’ type of dressing, record the type.

field.name: directPressure
field.semantics: false = No true = Yes

field.name: hemostaticDressing
field.semantics: false = No true = Yes

field.name: kerlixDressing
field.semantics: false = No true = Yes

field.name: pressureDressing
field.semantics: false = No true = Yes

field.name: otherType
field.semantics: If "Other", the type of dressing is recorded here.

fixedRecordData.name: AirwayTreatmentTypeRecord
fixedRecordData.semantics: [DA4700] Mark an ‘X’ for all types of airway treatment given. Self (none, patient breathes without assistance), NPA (nasopharyngeal airway), OPA (oropharyngeal airway), Cric (cricothyroidotomy), Trach (tracheotomy), ETT (endotracheal tube), SGA (supraglottic airway). Type. Record type of supraglottic airway treatment.

field.name: breathesWithoutAssistance
field.semantics: False = unchecked True = checked

field.name: nasopharyngealAirway
field.semantics: False = unchecked True = checked

field.name: oropharyngealAirway
field.semantics: False = unchecked True = checked

field.name: cricothyroidotomy
field.semantics: False = unchecked True = checked

field.name: tracheotomy
field.semantics: False = unchecked True = checked

field.name: endotrachealTube
field.semantics: False = unchecked True = checked

field.name: supraglotticAirway
field.semantics: False = unchecked True = checked

field.name: supraglotticAirwayType
field.semantics: Record type of supraglottic airway treatment.

fixedRecordData.name: AirwayConfirmationRecord
fixedRecordData.semantics:
[DA4700] Mark an ‘X’ for all methods used to confirm breathing, BS (breath sounds), Vis (visualization/chest rise), ETCO2 (End Tidal CO2 device).
False = unchecked True = checked

field.name: breathSounds
field.semantics: Airway confirmation by Breath Sounds

field.name: visualSigns
field.semantics: Airway Confirmation by Visual signs (visualization / chest rise)

field.name: endTidalCarbonDioxide
field.semantics: Airway confirmation by End Tidal CO2 device

fixedRecordData.name: AirwayTubeRecord
fixedRecordData.semantics: [DA4700] Size. Record the size of tube. Pos __ @ ___. Record the position (first blank) and select the Gums, Nare, or Teeth (second blank) from the dropdown list.

field.name: size
field.semantics: Size of tube in mm

field.name: position
field.semantics: Oral, Nasal or cricothyroid (throat)

field.name: tubeInsertionLocation
field.semantics: Select from dropdown list

field.name: nasalCannulaAndCatheter
field.semantics:
Nasal Cannula and Nasal catheters
False = unchecked True = checked

field.name: nonRebreatherMask
field.semantics:
Non-rebreather mask
False = unchecked True = checked

field.name: bagValveMask
field.semantics:
Bag valve mask.
False = unchecked True = checked

field.name: mechanicalVentilator
field.semantics:
Mechanical Ventilator.
False = unchecked True = checked

field.name: litersPerMinute
field.semantics: Record flow of oxygen in liters per minute.

fixedRecordData.name: AirwayIntubatedRecord
fixedRecordData.semantics: [DA4700] Mark an ‘X’ for Prior to transport (intubation occurred prior to transport); By transport crew (intubation occurred during transport)

field.name: priorToTransport
field.semantics: False = unchecked True = checked

field.name: byTransportCrew
field.semantics: False = unchecked True = checked

fixedRecordData.name: AirwaySuctionRecord

field.semantics: Record initial and subsequent vent setting values for PIP. PIP = peak inspiratory pressure.

fixedRecordData.name: PatientIdentificationRecord
fixedRecordData.semantics: [DA4700] Patient Identification section duplicated on all pages of the DA4700

field.name: lastName
field.semantics: Last name of patient

field.name: firstName
field.semantics: First name of patient.

field.name: middleInitial
field.semantics: Middle Initial of Patient.

field.name: battleRoster
field.semantics: Record first letter of patient’s first name, then first letter of patient’s last name, then record the last four numbers of patient’s Social Security number. For example, John Doe 123-12-1234 is Battle Roster # ‘JD1234’.

field.name: patientRank
field.semantics: Record Patient's rank.

field.name: patientUnit
field.semantics:
Record patient’s unit name.
Leave blank if patient is not a member of a military unit (e.g. civilian, enemy)

field.name: category
field.semantics: Select the patient’s category from the dropdown list.

field.name: socialSecurityAccountNumber
field.semantics: Patient SSN or ID

field.name: dateOfBirth
field.semantics: Format MM/DD/YYYY if known.

field.name: gender
field.semantics: Gender of patient.

field.name: allergyTypes
field.semantics: Select patient’s known drug allergies from dropdown list.

field.name: allergyOther
field.semantics: Specify allergy type if allergyOther is selected for Allergy.

fixedRecordData.name: EventRecord
fixedRecordData.semantics: [DA4700] Event section

field.name: eventDate
field.semantics: Format MM/DD/YYYY

field.name: eventTime
field.semantics:
Format HH:MM
Time that the injury occurred.

field.name: timeZone
field.semantics: L - Relative to local time Z - Relative to Zulu time

field.name: medicalMissionNumber
field.semantics: Record the medical mission number, for example (S)01-16A. MMN auto populates on page 2.

field.name: patientNumber
field.semantics: Record the patient’s number (first blank) for this evacuation.

field.name: patientNumberOf
field.semantics: Record the total number of patients (second blank) for this evacuation. This is used with the PatientNumber

field.name: tailToTail
field.semantics: Mark an ‘X’ Y (yes) or N (no) for tail-to-tail evacuation.

field.name: legNumber
field.semantics: First component of Leg#___ of ____

field.name: legNumberOf

fixedRecordData.semantics: [DA4700] 9 line section

field.name: time
field.semantics:
Format: hh:mm
Record 24-hour time of 9-Line (hhmm) in the same time zone as marked in ‘Time Zone’ above.

field.name: timeZone
field.semantics: Local or Zulu

field.name: platform
field.semantics: On automated form, select the platform from the dropdown list. Option to fill in the blank with individual platform description. Not feasible to enumerate the platforms.

field.name: dispatchCategory
field.semantics: On automated form, dropdown list Urgent, Priority or Routine

field.name: assessedCategory
field.semantics: On automated form, select Urgent, Priority or Routine.

field.name: injury

field.name: symptoms
field.semantics: Record the patient’s Signs and Symptoms.

field.name: treatment
field.semantics: Record the Treatment given to the patient.

field.name: comments
field.semantics: Record clarifying 9-Line comments.

fixedRecordData.name: PickupDropoffRecord
fixedRecordData.semantics: [DA4700] Pickup Dropoff section.

field.name: pickupTime
field.semantics: Time. Record 24-hour time of pickup. Time auto formats hh:mm.

field.name: pickupRole
field.semantics: Select the Role (level of care) from which the patient is picked up, from the dropdown list:1-POI (Point of Injury), 1-Aid Station, Role 2, Role 3, Role 4, Other. If ‘Other’, record the level of care/facility.

field.name: pickupRoleOther
field.semantics:
If the role is not found in the dropdown list.
Select the Role (level of care) from which the patient is picked up, from the dropdown list:1-POI (Point of Injury), 1-Aid Station, Role 2, Role 3, Role 4, Other. If ‘Other’, record the level of care/facility.

field.name: pickupRegion
field.semantics: Region. Select the region in which the pickup occurred. If ‘Other’, record the region name.

field.name: pickupRegionOther
field.semantics: Region. Select the region in which the pickup occurred. If ‘Other’, record the region name.

field.name: pickupLocation
field.semantics: Location. Record the specific geographic location of the pickup.

field.name: dropOffTime
field.semantics: Time. Record 24-hour time of dropoff. Time auto formats hh:mm.

field.name: dropOffRole
field.semantics: Role. Select the Role (level of care) at which the patient is dropped off, from the dropdown list: 1-Aid Station, Role 2, Role 3, Role 4, Other.

field.name: dropOffRoleOther
field.semantics: If ‘Other’, record the level of care/facility.

field.name: dropOffRegion
field.semantics: Region. Select the region in which the dropoff occurred. If ‘Other’, record the region name.

field.name: dropOffRegionOther
field.semantics: If ‘Other’, record the region name.

field.name: dropOffLocation
field.semantics: Location. Record the specific geographic location of the dropoff.

field.name: injuryLocation
field.semantics: Location or locations/area of injury. A single element array indicates an injury associated with a particular body location. Multiple array values indicate an injury associated with an area of the body.

field.semantics: InjuryType string allows the trainee to record any injury type. Originally set as an enumerated type, but examination of several DD1380's show variability. The trainee also needs to be able to record "incorrect" injury types.

field.semantics: Coarse Body Location/locations for DD1380. Empty array indicates an injury not associated with a particular location on the body. fixedRecordData.name: PFC_MistReportRecord
fixedRecordData.semantics: MIST report section of the PFC card

field.name: time
field.semantics: Time MIST report is/was sent

field.name: mechanismOfInjury
field.semantics: Document the mechanism of injury

field.name: stable
field.semantics: Document stable or unstable by circling the correct term. False/0=unstable, True/1=stable

fixedRecordData.name: PFC_InjuryTreatmentAnnotationRecord
fixedRecordData.semantics: Visually annotate an injury on the figure using a circled integer (injuryNumber) and associated injury descriptions and treatments in the adjacent columns associating the using the injuryNumber.

field.name: injuryNumber
field.semantics: Consecutive integers on the body outline to indicate where the injury occurred. For Area Injuries, the same integer would be placed on the different body areas.

field.name: injuryLocation
field.semantics: Array of locations where the injury occurred. Empty array indicates an injury not associated with a particular location on the body. A single element array indicates an injury associated with a particular body location. Multiple array values indicate an injury associated with an area of the body.

field.name: injuryDescription
field.semantics: Begin the entry with the injuryNumber from the body outline that the injury pertains to. Multiple injuries may be associated with a single injury annotation in the figure. Each associated injury would have the same injuryNumber.

field.name: injuryTreatment
field.semantics: Begin the entry with the injuryNumber from the body outline across from the injuryDescription the treatment pertains to. Multiple treatments may be associated with a single injuryDescription. Each associated treatment would have the same injuryNumber.
